intro: Agrostophyllum cyclopense, commonly known as the cyclopense grass tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its unique, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by distinctive, woody fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
